title: Blended Learning-Based Mathematics Teaching and Learning Process Design for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field (mathematics education theory, instructional design principles) and extensive practical experience (mathematics lesson design and implementation)
context.additional_context: Applying a blended learning model to adapt to smartphone-based learning environments. Emphasizes digital representation of mathematical concepts (e.g., algebra, geometry, statistics) and interactive learning activities.

learning_goals: Develop the ability to apply the ADDIE model at each stage for blended learning design and create instructional strategies that effectively convey mathematical concepts (e.g., equations, functions, geometry).
Development of strategies for operating math classes and designing problem-solving activities using smartphone-based digital tools (quiz apps, video conferencing)

Learners can develop blended learning materials (1 video of 5 minutes + 1 type of activity sheet) within a week, achieving an "Excellent" grade in 4 out of 5 rubric items during peer evaluation and expert review. (The activity sheet includes elements applicable to actual classes, such as math proofs, graph interpretation, and statistical analysis.)

At the end of the 1-week short-term course, learners receive an individual comprehension analysis report through formative assessments (3 quizzes: equation solving, probability calculation, geometric proof / 1 practical assignment: creation of math concept visualization materials). If the correct answer rate is below 80%, they are provided with customized feedback (2 concept explanation videos + 5 supplementary questions: function graph interpretation, statistical data analysis, etc.).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
